creator: scohen@apache.org
text:
An undocumented but confusing relationship exists between the "label" feature on
stcheckout and the "lock status" given to files in the operation.  The checkout
operation will fail with an unhelpful error message if either locked or unlocked
is true and a label is specified for the checkout.  

This is mandated by the StarTeam API, and logical, the point being that you
can't check a file out from any configuration other than the current label and
affect the lock status in any way.  The only way you can check out from a label
is to leave the lock status of each file unchanged.  In terms of the Ant
stcheckout task the way to leave lock status alone is for BOTH "locked" and
"unlocked" to be false.  This is the default, and is documented, but the
relationship of this to the labeled checkout is not documented.  It should be
documented and an informative error message should be printed if the user makes
this mistake.  Even though I wrote the task, I suffered for many months with
this until I had the time to gain an understanding of it.
